page.title: 10KIRKBURTON RAPIER DANCERS
page.content: The Kirkburton Dance dates from 1815. It used to be performed about six times a year. The dance team consists of 8 dancers and 4 musicians. They wear black trousers decorated with ribbons, white shirts, dark waistcoats, red neckerchief and clogs. The longsword is about 1 metre long. The dance is done by six people and starts with a clash of swords. A circle is then formed and the dancers take hold of the points of the other swords. Different figures are performed until the hand held sword circle is broken by making a lock.This lock is Star of David of interwoven swords.The dance from clash to lock is accompanied by music played on recorder, drum and accordian. Some of the tunes used are"Off She Goes"and "Oyster Girl".
